input_text:
Job Title: Summer Student- Engineering

Location: Jacksonville, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Description

Job Title: Summer Student- Engineering

City: Jacksonville / State: Illinois

Job Description

Join Reynolds Consumer Products… a world of opportunities! At Reynolds Consumer Products we are passionate about achieving results and have fun winning as a team! We provide amazing job opportunities for growth with competitive salaries and benefits in an exciting, dynamic, fast-paced, and fun workplace environment. Are you looking to build a strong career and make a positive impact? Then we have an opportunity for you! We are searching for a Summer Student- Engineering to join our team located at our facility in Jacksonville, IL.

Your Role:

As a Summer Student- Engineering who is currently enrolled in college, you will build on classroom learning through paid work directly related to your field. We embrace and accept individual experiences and backgrounds to achieve a diverse and inclusive workplace.

You will have the opportunity to:

Learn and follow the Kaizen continuous improvement process to reduce risks and mitigate hazards related to employee safety, quality issues, machine stoppages, and manufacturing costs.Work closely with a full-time engineer to learn the field of their discipline.Assist with day-to-day engineering activities regarding quality, production, and maintenance.Update prints, perform PPE audits, perform time studies, implement workflow improvements, and work on other special projects.Gain valuable hands-on experience.

Ultimately, this experience will help you get a head start in your career and will allow you to use your skills to make an impact on our company. We strive to build a diverse, inclusive, and talented workforce who will contribute to the Company’s vision, mission, and goals.

You will love it here if…

You are eager to learnYou seek an opportunity in which you can use your education and develop new skillsYou are a creative problem-solverYou are independent but enjoy working with a team

We need you to have:

Current enrollment and pursuit of a BS degree in Electrical or Manufacturing Engineering, or a related field.Completed at least 1 year of course work at an accredited university.Minimum GPA of 3.0.Minimum 18 years of age.Excellent capabilities in Microsoft Office.

Icing on the cake:

Prior experience in a manufacturing environment.Interest in the consumer product goods industry.

Want to know more? Check out our website or connect with us on LinkedIn!

Apply today to join a fast-growing innovative company!

Not a good fit but know someone who is? Please refer them!

Local candidates only, no relocation assistance available

Join Reynolds Consumer Products and 

Drive Your Career across a world of opportunities! 

For applicants or employees who are disabled or require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, you may request assistance by emailing us at Recruitment@ReynoldsBrands.com.

No recruiter calls or emails please.

Reynolds Consumer Products is an Equal Opportunity Employer EEO AA M/F/Vet/Disability.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, genetics, or disability.

Reynolds Consumer Products is an Equal Opportunity Employer that complies with the laws and regulations set forth in the following EEO is The Law Poster: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf

The Pay Transparency Regulations Frequently Asked Questions can be found on this link:

Pay Transparency Regulations Frequently Asked Questions | U.S. Department of Labor (dol.gov)

The poster and the supplement can be found on this link.

http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm

Experience Level (if available): Internship
